page.title: 04HISTORY OF SHIELDAIG VILLAGE
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF SHIELDAIG WAS BUILT AS A GROWTH POINT IN THE LATE 18TH EARLY 19TH CENTURY BY THE BRITISH FISHERIES SOCIETY. A NEW ROAD SURVEYED BY TELFORD WAS THEN BUILT FROM LOCHCARRON. THE OLD CHURCH OF SCOTLAND AND MANSE WAS ALSO BUILT TO TELFORD'S SPECEFICATIONS. UNFORTUNATELY THE ROOF OF THIS CHURCH FELL IN AND A NEW ONE WAS BUILT ON THE SAME SITE. ALL THAT REMAINS OF THE OLD CHURCH IS PART OF THE OUTER WALL WHICH IS NOW INFRONT OF THE NEW CHURCH BEHIND THE HOTEL IS THE STONE KNOWN AS THE MEETING STONE, WHERE THE FISHERMEN AND CROFTERS WOULD MEET TO DISCUSS THE DAILY WORK .
